article.title: On the Dispersion of Sparse Grids

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the largest empty box in the point set P(3, 2) represent?
choices: The dispersion of the point set.
The volume of the point set.
The number of points in the set.
The distance between two adjacent points.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the dark gray area in the figure represent?
choices: Parameters for which the Halton-Hammersley point set is smaller.
Parameters for which no smaller admissible set than P(k(ε), d) is known.
Parameters for which the dispersion of P(k(ε), d) is exactly ε.
Parameters for which the upper bounds for N.(ε, d) are nonconstructive.
An upper bound on the minimal dispersion of point sets.
The size of a Halton-Hammersley point set.
The dispersion of the point set P(k(ε), d).
A lower bound on the number of points in any admissible point set.
A lower bound on the number of points in any admissible point set.
The size of the point set P(k(ε), d).
The dispersion of the point set P(k(ε), d).
An upper bound on the minimal dispersion of point sets.
